Package it.unive.lisa.cfg

Interface CFG.SemanticFunction<H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>>

  • Type Parameters:
    H - the concrete type of HeapDomain embedded in the analysis states
    V - the concrete type of ValueDomain embedded in the analysis states
    Enclosing class:
    CFG
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface CFG.SemanticFunction<H extends HeapDomain<H>,​V extends ValueDomain<V>>
    A functional interface that can be used for compute the semantics of Statements, producing AnalysisStates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      AnalysisState<H,​V> compute​(Statement st, AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState, CallGraph callGraph, ExpressionStore<AnalysisState<H,​V>> expressions)
      Computes the semantics of the given Statement st, assuming that the entry state is entryState.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        AnalysisState<H,​V> compute​(Statement st,
                                 AnalysisState<H,​V> entryState,
                                 CallGraph callGraph,
                                 ExpressionStore<AnalysisState<H,​V>> expressions)
                          throws SemanticException
        Computes the semantics of the given Statement st, assuming that the entry state is entryState. The results of the semantic computations on inner Expressions must be saved inside expressions. If the computation needs information regarding the other CFGs, callGraph can be queried.
        Parameters:
        st - the statement whose semantics needs to be evaluated
        entryState - the entry state for the computation
        callGraph - the call graph that can be used to obtain semantic information on other cfgs
        expressions - the store where semantics results of inner expressions must be stored
        Returns:
        the abstract analysis state after the execution of the given statement
        Throws:
        SemanticException - if something goes wrong during the computation
